definitions: structure with rotating blades powered by wind to grind grain or pump water
toy consisting of colored vanes that spin when blown
examples: The old windmill on the hill still grinds wheat into flour
Dutch windmills pump water from the polders into canals
Children love watching their paper windmills spin in the breeze
She bought a colorful windmill toy from the seaside shop

definitions: opening in wall fitted with glass to admit light and air
rectangular area on computer screen displaying program or information
specific period when conditions are favorable for particular action or event
examples: She opened the window to let fresh air into the room
The stained glass windows cast colorful patterns on the floor
Close all browser windows before shutting down your computer
The error message appeared in a popup window
We have a narrow window of opportunity to submit the proposal
The launch window for the mission closes tomorrow morning

definitions: protective glass panel at the front of a vehicle, particularly in British usage
examples: The windscreen shattered when the stone hit it
Heavy rain made visibility through the windscreen almost impossible

definitions: protective glass panel at the front of a vehicle, particularly in American usage
examples: The windshield wipers struggled against the heavy snow
A crack appeared in the windshield after the temperature change

definitions: violent weather disturbance characterized by extremely strong and destructive winds
examples: The windstorm uprooted dozens of trees throughout the neighborhood
Insurance claims surged after the devastating windstorm hit the coast

definitions: side or direction from which the wind is blowing, opposite of leeward
examples: The sailors positioned themselves on the windward side of the yacht
Windward islands receive more rainfall than their leeward counterparts

definitions: alcoholic drink made from fermented grape juice or other fruits
deep purplish-red color resembling that of red wine
examples: They shared a bottle of wine over dinner
The vineyard produces exceptional wines from local grapes
She wore a wine colored dress to the gala
The curtains were a rich wine shade that complemented the decor

definitions: person who supervises the production of wine from grape cultivation to bottling
examples: The winemaker carefully monitored fermentation temperatures throughout the process
She studied under renowned winemakers in France before starting her vineyard

definitions: art and science of producing wine from grapes through fermentation and aging
examples: Traditional winemaking methods have been passed down through generations
Modern winemaking employs sophisticated technology to ensure consistent quality

definitions: establishment where wine is produced, stored, and often sold to visitors
examples: The winery offers tastings and tours every weekend
They visited several wineries during their trip through Napa Valley

definitions: paired appendage that enables birds, insects, and bats to fly
section of building extending from the main structure
flat horizontal surface on aircraft that provides lift during flight
faction within political party or organization representing particular ideology
examples: The eagle spread its wings and soared above the canyon
The butterfly's wings displayed intricate patterns and colors
The hospital's new wing houses the pediatric department
They renovated the east wing of the museum last year
Engineers inspected the aircraft's wings for stress fractures
The plane's wings flexed slightly during turbulence
The progressive wing of the party pushed for radical reforms
Conservative wing members opposed the proposed legislation

definitions: player positioned on the side of the field in soccer, hockey, or rugby
examples: The right winger scored with a brilliant shot from outside the box
The coach substituted both wingers to add fresh pace

definitions: pilot who flies beside and slightly behind the lead aircraft in formation
person who helps friend meet potential romantic partners in social situations
examples: His wingman maintained perfect formation throughout the mission
The squadron leader trusted his wingman to cover his six
He acted as wingman for his shy friend at the party
She needed a wingman to help navigate the singles event

definitions: distance between the tips of fully extended wings of bird or aircraft
examples: The albatross has the largest wingspan of any living bird
The aircraft's wingspan exceeded the hangar door width

definitions: deliberate closing and opening of one eye as signal or gesture
very brief period of time, especially regarding sleep
examples: She gave him a knowing wink across the crowded room
His wink suggested he was joking about the comment
I didn't get a wink of sleep last night
The storm passed in a wink

definitions: small edible marine snail with spiral shell, also called periwinkle
examples: They gathered winkles from the rock pools at low tide
Boiled winkles are a traditional seaside snack in Britain

definitions: person or team that wins a contest, game, or competition
thing that is successful or likely to be successful
examples: The winner of the marathon received a gold medal
They announced the lottery winner on live television
This new product looks like a real winner
The movie was a winner at the box office

definitions: act or instance of achieving victory in competition or contest
quality of being attractive, charming, or likely to succeed
examples: The team's winning streak extended to twelve games
Winning the championship was their ultimate goal
Her winning smile charmed everyone at the reception
The proposal had all the winning elements for approval

definitions: coldest season of the year between autumn and spring
period of decline, dormancy, or adversity in life or activity
examples: Winter temperatures dropped below freezing for weeks
They spent winter skiing in the mountains
He entered the winter of his career after decades of success
The company faced a long winter of reduced profits

definitions: small evergreen plant with aromatic leaves and red berries
flavoring extracted from wintergreen plants used in medicine and candy
examples: Wintergreen grows wild in the forest understory
The plant's wintergreen berries attract birds in winter
The candy had a strong wintergreen flavor
Wintergreen oil provides relief for sore muscles

definitions: period or season of winter, emphasizing the temporal aspect
examples: During wintertime, the lake freezes completely solid
Wintertime brings shorter days and longer nights

definitions: act of cleaning or drying something by rubbing with cloth or paper
complete removal or erasure of data from storage device
examples: Give the table a quick wipe before setting it
She kept baby wipes in her purse for emergencies
The technician performed a complete wipe of the hard drive
A factory wipe restored the phone to default settings

definitions: dramatic fall or crash especially in surfing, skiing, or skateboarding
total destruction, defeat, or elimination of something
examples: The surfer's wipeout was caught on camera
He had a nasty wipeout on the ski slope
The storm caused a complete wipeout of the coastal vegetation
The company faced financial wipeout after the scandal

definitions: device with rubber blade that clears rain from windshield or window
examples: The windshield wipers need replacement before the rainy season
Turn on the rear wiper for better visibility

definitions: thin flexible strand or rod of metal used for various purposes
telegram or cablegram sent by telegraph system
concealed listening device worn on person for recording conversations
examples: The electrician ran new wire through the conduit
Copper wire conducts electricity efficiently
They received a wire announcing his safe arrival
Send a wire if you need immediate assistance
The informant wore a wire during the meeting with suspects
The detective checked if he was wearing a wire

definitions: electronic device used to monitor telephone or internet communications secretly
act of secretly monitoring communications using electronic surveillance
examples: The court authorized a wiretap on the suspect's phone
They discovered an illegal wiretap in the office
The wiretap revealed crucial evidence about the conspiracy
Federal agents conducted a wiretap operation for months

definitions: system of wires providing electricity throughout building or device
pattern of neural connections in brain determining behavior or responses
examples: The old house needs complete rewiring for safety
Faulty wiring caused the electrical fire
The brain's wiring determines how we process information
Childhood experiences affect our emotional wiring

definitions: quality of having experience, knowledge, and good judgment accumulated over time
collection of wise sayings, teachings, or philosophical insights
examples: Her wisdom came from decades of life experience
The elder shared his wisdom with younger generations
Ancient wisdom texts offer guidance for modern problems
The book contains wisdom from various spiritual traditions

definitions: particular manner, way, or respect in which something is done or considered
examples: They arranged the books lengthwise on the shelf
The committee needs to think budget-wise before approving

definitions: feeling or expression of strong desire for something unattainable or unlikely
request believed to be granted by supernatural or magical means
examples: Her greatest wish was to travel the world
We send our best wishes for your recovery
Make a wish before blowing out the birthday candles
The genie granted him three wishes

definitions: forked bone between neck and breast of bird, traditionally broken for luck
examples: They broke the wishbone after Thanksgiving dinner
The child made a wish while pulling the wishbone

definitions: act of expressing hopes or desires for something to happen
examples: Wishing won't make your problems disappear
She spent hours wishing things could be different

definitions: small thin bunch or strand of hair, smoke, or similar material
small trace or hint of something barely perceptible
examples: A wisp of smoke rose from the extinguished candle
She tucked a wisp of hair behind her ear
There was just a wisp of hope remaining
A wisp of memory flickered through his mind

definitions: woody climbing plant with hanging clusters of fragrant purple or white flowers
examples: Purple wisteria draped over the garden pergola
The ancient wisteria blooms spectacularly every spring

definitions: mental faculty of combining ideas in quick and amusing ways
natural aptitude for clever and humorous expression or quick thinking
examples: His sharp wit made him popular at parties
She relied on her wit to navigate difficult situations
The comedian's wit delighted the audience
Oscar Wilde was famous for his brilliant wit

definitions: person, especially woman, believed to have magical powers through pact with evil spirits
informal derogatory term for an unpleasant or ugly woman
examples: The witch cast a spell on the village
Salem witch trials resulted in many executions
Don't be such a witch to your coworkers
The old witch next door complained about everything

definitions: practice of magic involving spells and communication with spirits or supernatural forces
examples: She was accused of witchcraft in the medieval trial
Modern witchcraft often focuses on nature worship

definitions: act of removing or taking away something from particular place or position
removal of money from bank account or financial institution
physical and mental symptoms experienced when stopping addictive substance use
examples: The withdrawal of troops began at dawn
His withdrawal from the competition surprised everyone
She made a large withdrawal from her savings account
The ATM has a daily withdrawal limit
He experienced severe withdrawal symptoms after quitting
Withdrawal from alcohol can be medically dangerous

definitions: process of plant shriveling and dying from loss of moisture
severely critical or scornful in manner causing humiliation
examples: The withering of leaves signals autumn's arrival
Drought caused rapid withering of the crops
She gave him a withering look of contempt
His withering criticism destroyed her confidence

definitions: act of refusing to give or holding back something that is due
portion of employee wages retained by employer for tax payment
examples: Withholding vital information could obstruct justice
The withholding of consent prevented the project
Check your pay stub for federal tax withholding
Adjust your withholding to avoid owing taxes

definitions: informal term for someone exceptionally skilled or clever at something
examples: She's a computer wiz who can fix any problem
The math wiz solved the equation in seconds

definitions: man with magical powers in legends and fairy tales
person with exceptional skill or accomplishment in particular field
computer program that guides users through complex tasks step by step
examples: The wizard cast a powerful spell to protect the kingdom
Merlin was King Arthur's trusted wizard
He's a wizard with numbers and financial analysis
The chef is a wizard in the kitchen
The installation wizard will guide you through the setup
Use the wizard to configure your email account

definitions: practice of magic or supernatural powers by wizards
impressive skill or accomplishment seeming almost magical
examples: The book described ancient wizardry and spell casting
Students at the school learned wizardry and potions
Her technical wizardry solved problems others couldn't
The chef's culinary wizardry amazed the diners

definitions: unsteady movement from side to side while trying to balance
state of uncertainty or instability in decision or position
examples: The table has an annoying wobble when you write
The bicycle wheel developed a wobble after the accident
There was a wobble in his confidence before the speech
The economy showed signs of wobble after the announcement

definitions: intense sorrow, grief, or distress
serious problems or difficulties causing distress
examples: She poured out her tale of woe to anyone who would listen
The poem expressed deep woe over lost love
Financial woes plagued the company for years
He recounted his woes with the legal system

definitions: bowl-shaped cooking pan used especially in Chinese cuisine for stir-frying
examples: Heat the wok before adding oil for stir-frying
The chef tossed vegetables expertly in the wok

definitions: large wild carnivorous mammal of the dog family living in packs
person who aggressively pursues romantic or sexual interests
examples: A wolf howled in the distance under the moon
The wolf pack hunted together through the forest
He had a reputation as a wolf who chased every woman
Watch out for that wolf at the office party

definitions: mythical creature that transforms from human into wolf, especially during full moon
examples: The wolfman terrorized the village every full moon
Classic horror films often featured the wolfman

definitions: stocky carnivorous mammal with dark fur known for strength and ferocity
examples: The wolverine defended its territory against the bear
Wolverines can travel vast distances across Arctic tundra

definitions: adult human female person typically associated with maturity and full development
examples: The woman became CEO after years of hard work
A woman approached asking for directions to the station
